text.name: CP_infoText
text.text: Courseplay(%s): Para ajuda, reportar bug ou notas de patch, favor visitar: https://github.com/Courseplay/Courseplay_FS22.

text.name: CP_error_could_not_generate_course
text.text: Could not generate course. The log may have more information.

text.text: Onde começar o trabalho no campo

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_openHudWithMouse_tooltip

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_allowReversePathfinding_title

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_allowReversePathfinding_tooltip

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_foldImplementAtEnd_title
text.text: Dobrar implemento no final da rota

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_foldImplementAtEnd_tooltip
text.text: Ativar / desativar dobrar o implemento no final da rota.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_raiseImplementLate_tooltip
text.text: Levantar o implemento no início ou no final da curva.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_lowerImplementEarly_tooltip
text.text: Baixar o implemento no início ou no final da curva.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_turnOnField_tooltip
text.text: Virar no campo. Não é possível com todos os implementos.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_pipeAlwaysUnfold_tooltip

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_selfUnload_tooltip
text.text: Colheitadeira descarrega na carreta. Não suportado em multiferramentas ou no nodo comboio.

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_unloadOnFirstHeadland_tooltip

text.name: CP_vehicle_setting_fieldWorkSpeed_tooltip
text.text: Velocidade máxima ao trabalhar no campo

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_title
text.text: Configuração do gerador de rota de (%s)

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_subTitle_basic
text.text: Configuração do gerador de rota de (%s)

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_headlandOverlapPercent_tooltip
text.text: Sobrepor largura faixa de cabeceira por porcentagem

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_fieldMargin_tooltip
text.text: Valores positivos reduzem o tamanho do campo para adicionar um buffer ao redor da área trabalhada, valores negativos aumentam a área trabalhada além do limite do campo.

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_rowsToSkip_tooltip
text.text: Pular faixas para cima ou para baixo ao mudar para próxima faixa

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_rowsPerLand_tooltip
text.text: Quando o modo central é 'terras', essas várias faixas estão em cada bloco

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_isClockwise_tooltip
text.text: Dirigir no sentido horário ou anti-horário na cabeceira

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_manualRowAngleDeg_title
text.text: Ângulo das linhas para cima/para baixo

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_manualRowAngleDeg_tooltip
text.text: Ângulo das linhas para cima/para baixo (0 será norte) quando for manual

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_islandBypassMode_tooltip
text.text: Como a rota deve contornar ilhas no campo

text.name: CP_vehicle_courseGeneratorSetting_multiTools_tooltip
text.text: Números dos veículos na mesma rota.

text.name: CP_global_setting_wageModifier_tooltip

text.name: CP_global_setting_controllerHudSelected_tooltip
text.text: Use o Hud, que pode ser controlado com um Gamepad.

text.name: CP_global_setting_maxDeltaAngleAtGoal_tooltip
text.text: Diferença angular máxima permitida na meta, valores maiores são mais rápidos, mas menos precisos

text.name: CP_global_setting_deltaAngleRelaxFactor_title
text.text: Fator de relaxamento do ângulo delta

text.name: CP_global_setting_deltaAngleRelaxFactor_tooltip
text.text: Fator para diminuir a precisão do pathfinder com iterações malsucedidas, valores maiores são mais rápidos

text.name: CP_global_setting_showsAllActiveCourses_tooltip

text.name: CP_customFieldManager_confirm_save
text.text: Deseja salvar a rota gravado como campo personalizado %s?

text.name: CP_customFieldManager_draw_header
text.text: Clique no botão direito do mouse para desenhar linhas no campo personalizado.

text.name: CP_help_page_startJobMenuBase_text
text.text: When selecting a vehicle, you will see it's loaded course and the course manager (if there is one loaded), and the vehicle options. The global settings are always present. With create a job, you will not only gain access the default Jobs from FS22, but also to CP: Fieldwork and CP: wrap/collect bales.

text.name: CP_help_page_startJobMenuFunctions_text
text.text: To start off with your first CP Job, you have to select a vehicle with a valid tool attached. Then, by clicking on create job, you can select CP: Fieldwork for fieldwork tools or CP: wrap/collect with a bale wrapper or bale collector attached.

text.name: CP_help_page_readyJobMenuBase_text
text.text: With CP: Fieldwork selected, you have a Target position, wich you might know from the Giants Helper and a new Field position. That field position is used to select the field where you want to work on, as well as the start point of the course (or Endpoint). If you let Giants drive your vehicle to the field to start the job, with start at: you can choose where the CP Driver will start. Lane offset is only used in multitool courses, more about that in a later topic.

text.name: CP_help_page_readyJobMenuFunctions_text
text.text: The target position is only used if you will start the job from that menu, it will tell the Giants Helper to drive to that location and give control over to courseplay. As said before, field position is to select the field and must be placed in order to open the generator. Depending on where to start the fieldwork, the field position will also tell the generator where the start or end point should be. If you have a valid field, the border will be highlighted in a white line. Now you are able to open the course generator. More about this in the next topic.

text.name: CP_help_page_JobMenuExtras_text
text.text: When you have a generated course, you can else start the Job (remember to set a Target position) or drive by yourself to the field and use the HUD to start the course. Alternatively you can use AutoDrive to drive to a AutoDrive Target and start CP.

text.name: CP_help_page_courseGeneratorBase_text
text.text: The course generator is the core of the Fieldwork. With this tool you will generate a course, based on the field condition and the settings you choose, how your helper should work on the field. You can always change values and hit generate course and have a look, what impact does a certain value have on your course. Experimenting with it and learn on how each setting work, is the best way to get used to it.

text.name: CP_help_page_courseGeneratorBaseFunctions_text
text.text: Basics: The first few values you see here, are real basic stuff. - Work width: Most tools get the exact work width detected and you won't have to care about this setting at all. Adjusting it, will have an impact of your overall course. - Multiple Tools: That setting is used, when you want more then just 1 Tool to work on your course. As this gets a bit more complicated, there is an own help topic for it. - Number of Headlands: The best way to keep your tools on the field while doing their job, is to add Headlands. The Number of the Headlands multiplied by the work width should but at least the total length of your vehicle plus the attached tool Center options: - Field center: There are different modes on how your field center pattern should look like. The classic and most used one is up/down. Spiral, Racetrack and Lands have their own specific advantages over the others. Lands for example will have Combines pipe point out of the fruit most of the time to easier unload them. - Up/Down row direction: automatic mostly finds the best direction, but sometimes the longest edge fits better. If you are not happy with either one, choose manual and set the direction manually. - Rows to skip: This is a very helpful option to accelerate your work, as tools won't have to back up to turn into the next close row. - Rows per Land: This have only impact when field center is set to lands and will tell the generator how many rows each land should have. The more rows, the lesser lands will be generated. - Up/down row angle: As said before, when the Up/Down row direction is set to manual, this setting will tell the generate the direction.

text.name: CP_help_page_courseGeneratorHeadland_text
text.text: Headland settings will only show up, when you have set at least one at Number of headlands. You gain options for where to start on, corner settings, direction and overlap. Headlands are highly suggested to prevent tools leaving the field for their turns.

text.name: CP_help_page_courseGeneratorHeadlandFunctions_text
text.text: - Start work on: As mentioned in the extended AI Menu, the field position is used to set the start or end position for the field work course. When set to start on headland, it tells where the start should be. When changed to start on rows, it will tell where to end the work. - Headland corners: Smooth will have a simple smoothing over the corners, This works all tools, but will lead into tiny unworked patches. They can be reduced with overlap, but never disappear. Sharp will generate a turn based on the angle of the field border angle. Round will take the current selected vehicles turn radius into account to have the best round corner for that tool. Headland direction: clockwise or counter-clockwise. This can be important for Combine and Harvester, depending on wich side the pipe or conveyer belt is. Headland overlap: How much % overlap all Headlands should have. The 1st one will have no overlap with the field border, but the inner ones will overlap with their neighbor.

text.name: CP_help_page_courseGeneratorExtras_text
text.text: Field Margin explanation: Positive values reduce field size to add a buffer around the worked area in case you have obstacles near the field border. Negative values enlarge worked area beyond the field boundary to cover up field borders that are not perfectly detected.

text.name: CP_help_page_courseManagerBase_text
text.text: The path to the course files is: ..\My Games\FarmingSimulator2022\modSettings\FS22_Courseplay\Courses\Mapname.SampleModMap (Or for Vanilla e.g. MapUS). The course manager works different from what you are used in FS19. When you create a folder, it will also be created at that location. You will need at least one folder to save your course.

text.name: CP_help_page_courseManagerBaseFunctions_text
text.text: When you have a course loaded, you can save it by clicking on the folder where you want to save it, a pop up window will appear where you can enter the name of your course. The name and location can be changed later. To remove the course from your vehicle, click on 'Clear current course'. To load a course, you have to select the folder first, then click on load course and then on the course you want to load. Clicking on change mode, activates the edit mode of the course manager.

text.name: CP_help_page_courseManagerEdit_text
text.text: Is the edit mode active, you can: - Moving a course in to another directory. - Deleting a course or directory. - Renaming a course or directory.

text.name: CP_help_page_courseManagerEditFunctions_text
text.text: To move a course, you just click on 'move entry', then click on the course, then click on the new folder where you want to move it. Rename is even more simple, click on 'rename', click on the course and the same pop up window (like when you save the course) will appear. For deleting a course or a folder, you will be asked if you rly want to do it. Pls note that, to delete a folder, it has to be empty! A pop up window will inform you, if that folder sill contains a course.

text.name: CP_help_page_minihud_text
text.text: A: Clicar no nome do veículo abre a página de configurações do veículo. B: Alternar onde iniciar a rota com um clique. C: Clicando no nome da rota abrirá o Menu AI com o gerador de rotas aberto. D: Inicie o auxiliar do Courseplay. E: Mostra o waypoint atual/total de waypoints. F: Clicar no ícone abre a página de configurações gerais. G: Fecha o HUD. H: Diminuir e aumentar a largura de trabalho. Uma linha vermelha no seu veículo mostra a configuração atual. I: Valor para deslocamento horizontal, + esquerda, - direita. J: Valor para deslocamento vertical, + para trás, - para frente. K, L e M: Clicar no texto irá redefinir suas alterações para os valores automáticos. N: Esta área mostra a distãncia da faixa se você tiver uam rota com multiferramentas carregado. Clicar no texto alterna as posições. O: Iniciar/parar rota no campo customizado. P: Excluir rota do veículo

text.name: CP_help_page_customFieldRecord_text
text.text: Há duas formas de criar um campo personalizado. A primeira é usar a função de gravar do HUD. Inicie a gravação na borda do campo. Uma vez feito, pressione o botão novamente e você será perguntado se deseja salvá-lo.

text.name: CP_help_page_customFieldDone_text
text.text: No Menu AI, você verá sua borda de campo gravada. Ao clicar no nome, você terá a opção de excluí-lo ou renomeá-lo.

text.name: CP_help_page_customFieldDraw_text
text.text: A segunda opção é desenhá-lo no Mapa do Menu AI. Se nenhum trator ou outro veículo estiver selecionado (clique com o botão esquerdo em algum lugar no mapa), você terá a opção de desenhar um campo personalizado. Quando iniciado, o texto desenha linhas de campo personalizadas com o botão direito do mouse será exibido. Use o botão direito do mouse para clicar em uma posição em que você deseja começar. O próximo clique direito irá desenhar uma linha do seu ponto inicial até a sua segunda posição, que será o ponto inicial para a próxima linha.

text.name: input_CP_DBG_CHANNEL_SELECT_NEXT
text.text: CP: Selecione canal anterior de debug.

text.name: input_CP_DBG_CHANNEL_TOGGLE_CURRENT
text.text: CP: Mudar canal de debug atual.

text.name: input_CP_DBG_CHANNEL_MENU_VISIBILITY
text.text: CP: Mostrar canal de debug sim/não.
